fullContent: Infosys faces a penalty of over Rs 66 lakh from the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore related to GST payments. Simultaneously, Infosys plans to acquire a 75% stake in Versent Group, a subsidiary of Telstra, for approximately Rs 1,336 crore. This acquisition aims to enhance AI-enabled cloud and digital solutions for Australian businesses through a strategic collaboration.

Vietnam Buys Its First U.S. Crude Oil Cargo for 2025
summary: Vietnam has bought its first cargo of U.S. crude oil for 2025, Reuters reported on Thursday, citing sources. Vietnam, which is estimated to have made its previous purchase of U.S. crude at the end of last year, has now bought 1 million barrels of West Texas Intermediate crude...
fullContent: Vietnam has bought its first cargo of U.S. crude oil for 2025, Reuters reported on Thursday, citing sources. Vietnam, which is estimated to have made its previous purchase of U.S. crude at the end of last year, has now bought 1 million barrels of West Texas Intermediate crude for November delivery, according to Reuters’ sources. Vietnamese refinery Binh Son Refining and Petrochemical (BSR) purchased the American crude from commodity trading giant Mercuria, the sources added. Earlier this year, Vietnam and the United States signed an…

‘Virtually unchanged’: Hong Kong’s population stabilises for first time in decade
summary: Hong Kong’s population has stabilised and remained “virtually unchanged” for the first time in a decade, following waves of significant emigration and an influx of non-local talent in recent years. The Census and Statistics Department said on Thursday that Hong Kong’s midyear...
fullContent: Hong Kong’s population has stabilised and remained “virtually unchanged” for the first time in a decade, following waves of significant emigration and an influx of non-local talent in recent years. The Census and Statistics Department said on Thursday that Hong Kong’s midyear population stood at 7,527,500, up slightly by 3,400 from 12 months ago, accounting for an increase of less than 0.005 per cent. The government attributed the stasis to ongoing measures in talent attraction and labour...

title: Red flags for the economy: Economist points to 3 warning signs of an imminent recession in US

fullContent: ​Zandi, chief economist at Moody’s Analytics, shared his concerns in a recent thread on social media X (formerly Twitter), laying out what he believes are the most telling red flags, according to the Business Insider report. While the economy hasn’t yet met the technical definition of a recession, two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, Zandi argues that subtler but significant cracks are beginning to show, as per the report.

India among fastest growing economies: JSW Group chairman Sajjan Jindal
summary: JSW Group chairman Sajjan Jindal refuted Donald Trump's remarks about India's economy, emphasizing its rapid growth and potential during JSW Cement's listing ceremony at the NSE. Jindal highlighted India's position as the fastest-growing large economy, dismissing Trump's "dead...
fullContent: JSW Group chairman Sajjan Jindal refuted Donald Trump's remarks about India's economy, emphasizing its rapid growth and potential during JSW Cement's listing ceremony at the NSE. Jindal highlighted India's position as the fastest-growing large economy, dismissing Trump's "dead economy" comment. JSW Cement aims for aggressive growth, aligning with India's needs, while its shares debuted with a premium, reflecting investor confidence.
